Letâ€™s make them tidy. # Making flu data tidy flu_tidy <- flu_df %>% pivot_longer(cols = c('Argentina','Australia','Austria','Belgium','Bolivia','Brazil','Bulgaria','Canada','Chile','France','Germany','Hungary','Japan','Mexico','Netherlands','New.Zealand','Norway','Paraguay','Peru','Poland','Romania','Russia','South.Africa','Spain','Sweden','Switzerland','Ukraine','United.States','Uruguay'), names_to = "country", values_to = "cases") flu_tidy <- separate(flu_tidy, Date, into = c("year", "month", "day")) # Making dengue data tidy dengue_tidy <- dengue_df %>% pivot_longer(cols = c("Argentina", "Bolivia", "Brazil", "India", "Indonesia", "Mexico", "Philippines", "Singapore", "Thailand", "Venezuela"), names_to = "country", values_to = "cases") dengue_tidy <- separate(dengue_tidy, Date, into = c("year", "month", "day"))
